page.title: 08FISHING
page.content: Fishing in this area has changed. There used to be 10 boats working from this harbour 50 years ago and 49 a century ago. Now there are just two large boats based here for full time fishing. There are others - last year 10 - which are used for part-time fishing, and for pleasure. Just 4 men work on the two boats based here. They fish for crab between March and October using creels which are laid out in 'fleets' of 20 between Duncansby Head and Sinclairs Bay. Each boat puts out about 120 creels. These are mostly made of wood, but more steel-framed ones are being used,especially where fleets are near the rocky shoreline in mid-season The crab are then packed into wooden boxes and are collected by processors from the south (recently Helmsdale) daily.
